title: Using the slope formula $$m=\frac{y2-y1}{x2-x1}$$ to calculate the slope $$m$$.
$$m=\frac{y2-y1}{x2-x1}$$ $$=$$ $$\frac{b+1-1}{a-a}$$ $$=$$ $$\frac{1}{0}$$. The slope is undefined because division by zero occurs. This indicates a vertical line.
Since both points have the same x-coordinate (a), the equation is: $$x=a$$.
